revised_title: Investigating the Effects of Syringing Warm Water into the Thorax of a Bitch
tldr: Dr. William Musgrave conducted experiments injecting warm water into the thorax of a greyhound bitch, observing symptoms such as rigour, shortness of breath, and heat. He conjectured that there may be an unknown duct in the thorax that conveys off excess liquid, and suggested that further anatomical experiments could provide a full decision on this matter.
